question: What did Isaac have?
answer1: a boat and a couple of goats

question: Why did Isaac only have a boat and a couple of goats?
answer1: He was poor.
answer2: He did not have much money.

question: What did Isaac's wife feed the goats?
answer1: fish leavings and the grass she was able to gather on the surrounding hills

question: Why did Isaac not get along with his neighbor?
answer1: The neighbor thought himself entitled to far more than such a beggarly fellow as Isaac.
answer2: The neighbor wanted to get him out of the way in order to take for himself the anchorage before Isaac's hut.

question: What happened because of the tremendous storm?
answer1: Isaac had to throw all his fish overboard in order to lighten ship and save his life.

question: How did Isaac keep the boat afloat?
answer1: steered a careful course between and across the mountainous waves

question: What did Isaac think would happen after steering the boat for some time?
answer1: He ought to touch land somewhere.

question: What did Isaac think was happening because he sailed on and on without sight of land?
answer1: The wind had veered.

question: What did Isaac hear from the stern of the boat?
answer1: a hideous cry

question: How did Isaac feel when he thought his last hour had come?
answer1: scared

question: Why did Isaac grow hungry, thirsty, and weary?
answer1: He had been on the boat for a very long time.
answer2: He had no food or water on the boat.
answer3: He had sailed for a long time without anything to eat or drink.

question: How did Isaac feel to reach land?
answer1: excited

question: Where did the narrow path lead to?
answer1: a green turf-roofed cottage of clay that rose above the field

question: Who sat before the door?
answer1: a little man

question: What was the man doing when Isaac saw him?
answer1: puffing away at a little pipe

question: Who were the man's sons?
answer1: cormorants

question: What will the man give Isaac after inviting him inside his house?
answer1: food and water

question: How did Isaac feel when he saw the inside of the house?
answer1: awe

question: What happened no water how much Isaac ate or drank?
answer1: His plate was never empty.

question: How did Isaac feel when the three sons came?
answer1: scared

question: What happened when Isaac sat down and drank with the three sons?
answer1: They became good friends.

question: Why was Isaac unable to catch any fish?
answer1: He had taken along his own fishing-tackle.

question: What happened because the sea was so full of fish?
answer1: They could not even put out an anchor.

question: How did Isaac feel when he was unable to catch any fish?
answer1: disappointed

question: What did the man give Isaac when he did not catch any fish?
answer1: a couple hooks

question: Why did Isaac get homesick?
answer1: He had been at Urdost for a long time.
answer2: He missed his wife and children.

question: How did Isaac feel towards the man?
answer1: grateful

question: What course did the man tell Isaac to set out to reach Urdost?
answer1: follow the cormorant when he heads for the open sea

question: What happened when Isaac got underway?
answer1: There was no Udrost in sight.

question: What happened no matter how many fish Isaac took away?
answer1: The stands were continually filled with fresh fish.

question: Why was Isaac able to buy a new schooner?
answer1: He got so much money for his fish.
